Chelsea supporters particularly rallied behind their under-pressure manager Jose Mourinho, who had recently been embroiled in controversy following comments that led to a substantial fine and a suspended stadium ban.

Instead, he opted to give Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Baba Rahman opportunities to shine. For Aston Villa, Tim Sherwood made four changes, hoping this refreshed roster could produce a better outcome.

Loftus-Cheek attempted to initiate several attacks, but his passes often lacked precision. The youngster seemed determined to make the most of his chance, yet the absence of Hazard’s creativity was noticeable.

Villa, on the other hand, looked to exploit any opportunity on the counterattack. Grealish was particularly dynamic, continuously taking on Chelsea defenders and winning free kicks in dangerous areas. Despite Grealish’s efforts, Villa struggled to produce clear-cut chances, and their final ball often let them down.
